issue.title: Bug. Ef Core cannot translate postgresql Array functions when used optimized EF Core Model

repository.name: efcore.pg
repository.description: Entity Framework Core provider for PostgreSQL

issue.body:
Whe i use Optimized DbContext:
`dotnet ef dbcontext optimize --context MainDbContext`
Postgresql array functions cannot translate to sql:

![image](https://github.com/npgsql/efcore.pg/assets/21160725/6792643e-7ae3-4215-8c6a-870c5091434f)

I tried to use many funtions from documentation https://www.npgsql.org/efcore/mapping/array.html.
Works only this: `String.Join(separator, array)`
I use NET 8

body: @roji Any idea if this is a regression?

@ajcvickers I don't think so - the original issue (https://github.com/npgsql/efcore.pg/issues/3168) was filed against 8.0 back in May... But it actually seems like it could be pretty serious to me - possibly a patching candidate? It sort of slipped under my radar, thanks for bringing it back...

issue.title: Queries on primitive collections cannot be translated when using a compiled model

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

body: See #35273 for a very likely dup of this - we should verify that one once this is fixed.

issue.title: Add support for primitive collections to the compiled model

repository.name: efcore
